intro: Korthalsella striata, commonly known as the striped korthalsella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Korthalsella striata is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
